data.title: Best pizza in central Virginia
data.text: My wife & I made our appearance between lunch & dinner, when most restaurants are closed.  Environment was urban stylish- another great addition to downtown.  We ordered pizza with mushroom & sausage. It was excellent.  Top selection of draft beers to round out the meal.

data.title: Nice atmosphere, reasonable price for  slice of pizza
data.text: I have visited Benny Scarpetta three times now. I love the pepperoni slice, the size is worth $5.00. What I like the least is the time it takes to get one slice of pepperoni especially during the noon lunch hour.

data.title: Ordered the whole pie
data.text: The pizza was very good, not greasy as I thought it might be.  However, they aren't organized!  They do not tell you that you order before being seated, so make sure you order as you walk into the establishment.  We did order at 6:50pm, told us it would be about 30 minutes for the whole pie since they were running behind and also training new staff.  At 7:30, we were told it would be only 6 more minutes, so sorry for the delay.  7:50, we were told it would be only 6 more minutes ... again, "we are training".  We saw each individual come and go, do take out or sit, eat and leave.  At 8pm, our pizza arrived ... it was good and filling, but not sure worth an 1-1/2 hour wait.  Advice, if you want a whole pie order about an hour in advance prior to pick up.  They removed the larger pizzas, then upon serving put the slices back into the oven to warm ... we will order from there again, but not go sit and be served.

data.title: Great big pizza
data.text: Lobe the pizza it isn't soggy.  Crispy and very good.  The decor is interesting in a good way looks like you walked into someone's garage with old tools on the wall with other items.  The walls have a very unique painting on them.  The people are very nice.  The silces are extra large and the whole pizza is giant.

data.title: Great food! Great Staff!
data.text: Been to this location twice now. Love the food, atmosphere and staff. Food is great, well-priced, and generously portioned. Atmosphere is great! There is music playing, people conversing, kicking back and having a great time. The staff there were great! They were courteous and funny. Highly recommended! A+

data.title: Budget-friendly, character and sauce
data.text: Dine here for the pie and atmosphere. One slice of Benny's pizza can satisfy an average adult appetite, it's equivalent to a personal pan pizza. The decor reminds me of Rivermont Pizza. It's open late, which is a plus for this town. Staff handles volumes of people well, I visited during Get Downtown and didn't have to wait for my slice of pepperoni. FYI limited toppings, don't let that discourage you. Come!!!!🍕

data.title: Great pizza for take-out
data.text: The pizza here is great and prices are fair. Seating inside is very cramped, so it's best to get your order to-go.

data.title: Giant Pizza worthy of being that big
data.text:
Sometimes people make BIG food that really doesn't deserve to be that big. This is the rare exception. This is a BIG pizza. I'm a hearty eater but there is simply no way I could eat 2 slices. But if I could - I would...because it is that delicious. Crisp but not cracker thin crust topped with top quality sauce and cheese. I had pepperoni (classic) and my sister had one of the special topping of the month selections - garlic and mushroom (they have 2 special choices each month). So I tasted both and found that the pepperoni was not just a fluke - her pizza tasted great too! And what a bargain! $5 for a slice that covers 2 paper plates. You CAN get a whole pizza for $35 and if you can eat it in less than an hour, you get cash!! I'd have to grow some sort of external stomach to even try.

What are the down sides? The only one I've heard repeatedly is wait time. I was there for lunch and I think it was about 10 minutes between ordering and eating. Totally worth it. I've heard some folks indicate longer wait times when they were busier - I figure those kinks will get worked out.

If you are hungry and need both BIG and DELICIOUS - head to Benny Scarpetta's

data.title: Huge slice of pizza
data.text: The menu is simple with 4 types of pizza and two monthly specials. Craft beer in bottle or juice, rootbeer, water and soda to pick from cooler. You walk up and order your slice and grab your drink and sit down and wait. A huge slice of pizza on two plates is prepared. One slice and you are full!!! The decor is different and fun to look at while waiting. At 5 dollars a slice it is worth it. The price includes tax. There is sides of garlic butter or sauce you can purchase for extra. Good New York style pizza.
